metadata.title: Erowid Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Diphenhydramine | cid: 3100
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) and drug tests.
Erowid name: diphenhydramine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    Donate and receive yours!

Diphenhydramine (Benadryl)

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Diphenhydramine Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? NO Possible to Test for? YES Will Trigger Tests for Other Substances? Yes : Benzodiazepines, PCP, Tricyclic Antidepressants Detection Period in Urine 2-4 days (single use)

FALSE POSITIVES #

Possible False Positives Triggered

Diphenhydramine, especially at high doses, has been reported to cause false positives for Benzodiazepines (such things as Xanax or Valium) 1. The false positives occur using the screening-type tests (sticks, cups, etc) but confirmatory tests using GC/MS and other more rigorous techniques should clear any false positive. Other sources list Diphenhydramine as a possible source for false positives for PCP2 and tricyclic anti-depressants3.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This segment provides specific information about diphenhydramine (Benadryl) related to drug testing, including detection times, potential false positives for substances like benzodiazepines, PCP, and tricyclic antidepressants, as well as cautionary notes. It is relevant to the broader drug testing and substance awareness content of the webpage, aiding users in understanding diphenhydramine's detection and false positive risks.

metadata.title: Erowid Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Diphenhydramine | cid: 3100
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) and drug tests.
Erowid name: diphenhydramine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

Drug Testing Vault

References #

NHB. "False Positive Urine Screen". Erowid Experience Report 77774. March 2009. [ Full Text ]

Sena SF, Kazimi S, Wu AH. "False-positive phencyclidine immunoassay results caused by venlafaxine and O-desmethylvenlafaxine." Clin Chem. 2002;48(4):676-7.

Sorisky A, Watson DC. "Positive diphenhydramine interference in the EMIT-st assay for tricyclic antidepressants in serum [letter]". Clin Chem. 1986;32(4):715. [ Full Text ]


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt from the Erowid page provides a detailed overview of diphenhydramine (Benadryl) drug testing, including detection periods, false positive risks, and related resources. It is relevant for understanding how diphenhydramine may affect drug test results and is situated within the broader context of drug testing information on the site.
